instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cam
threads.message:
Hi
Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with 'no camera connected' here. Never really dug into no camera issues that far.

It has 5V on the connector. I decided to check the filters on the backside, all resistance was fine, i checked them for any mall voltage/signal and it was present. But as i was checking this i saw smoke from the other side of the board. Now we have no signals/activity of any kind on the <SIGNAL>MIPI_DATA</SIGNAL> lines. 

I couldn't locate the burnt area, It looks like it came from the connector itself however the connector has no visable damage, ive inspected both the inside pins and external condition of the connector and there is nothing visibly damaged. 

any help would be appreciated.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cam
threads.message: Only thing that can smoke is L4010. Also did you even try another LCD with camera?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cam
threads.message:
L4010 measures okay,
Yes another assembly has been tried.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cam
threads.message: Not much else besides <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> then. I would not bother with that....
